humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that the largest tumor size measured is 2.5 cm, which falls within the range for a T2 tumor (more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm). The presence of ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) or the percentage of the tumor occupied by in situ component does not affect the T stage for invasive ductal carcinoma, so the T stage is still T2. The T stage is determined by the size of the largest tumor, regardless of the type of carcinoma, so the T stage is still T2 for invasive ductal carcinoma. Tumor size is used to determine the T stage, even when the histological type is Medullary Adenocarcinoma, so the T stage is still T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that the invasive ductal carcinoma in the right breast measures 2.5 cm in largest dimension (specimen 3, block 3, section A). Based on the TNM staging system for cancer, a T2 stage is assigned to invasive breast cancers that measure between 2.1 and 5 cm in size. Therefore, the patient's T stage is T2.
